headline: Simple BBQ Ribs
description: This BBQ ribs recipe may be different than others you've tried, but for super tender ribs, give it a try! Lean, country-style pork ribs are boiled first, then baked.

video.description: These tender, authentic ribs are boiled and baked, and so simple to make.
video.name: Simple Barbeque Ribs

name: Simple BBQ Ribs

recipeInstructions.text: Place ribs in a large pot and cover with water. Stir in kosher salt, garlic powder, and pepper, and bring water to a boil over medium heat. Continue to boil until ribs are tender, 40 to 45 minutes.
While the ribs are boiling, preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Remove ribs from the pot, and place them in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Pour barbeque sauce over ribs. Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until the internal temperature of the pork has reached 160 degrees F (70 degrees C), 1 to 1 1/2 hours.

review.reviewBody: ‘Took the advice of some and boiled them in 1/2 beef broth, then let them sit in the water for 1 1/2 hours before putting on the sauce and putting them in the oven. They did not disappoint! Even my kids who don’t like ribs loved these!!
These ribs were delicious. As good or better than any rib you will get from a restaurant. Thanks for sharing this recipe.
I can’t get enough, my family loves them , great recipe. Thanks for sharing.

After discrading the first batch, We cooked again without the kosher salt and w/o the BBQ sauce. We wanted low sodium and no chemicals. We used Lemon/Lime, little bit of ketchup. That made these perfect. We prefer regualr sea salt.
Very delicious! The ribs were fall apart tender. Thanks so much for sharing.

Was voluntold to bring a BBQ rib dish for work. Not a big BBQ fan but this recipe just can't be beat. Have made it 3 times now and tonight will be 4. I make it just as it calls for and I definitely think it stands its ground with restaurant offerings. I use Sweet Baby Rays. Just a simple, reliable, tasty recipe.

I followed the recipe exactly... except the cooking times. I took them out of the boiling water after 35 minutes because they already seemed cooked. And I only had them in the oven for 10 minutes and in the end, they turned out a bit dry. Would not use this recipe again.

I like to put the rib sauce or the barbecue sauce rather on the country style ribs while they're cooking not just the last half an hour so I tried it your way this time and it came out okay but I think next time I'm going to go back to my way thanks for the recipe

I Followed the recipe and other reviewers tips. I boiled the country ribs per recipe and added soy sauce, country Bobs and old bay. I boiled for 30 minutes and simmered for 30 minutes then left them in the pot for 45 more minutes to marinate. After that I put them in a 300 degree oven for one hour. Turned the oven off and left them in there for another half hour. I had sauced them per the recipe but finished them in my air fryer at 375 degrees for 6 minutes. They were good and very tender probably the best oven made ribs I’ve ever made or eaten. I would make again even though it is a long process. The air fryer was a good addition for the final result.

Really good and easy! Did as others and boiled 45 mins and let sit in water after for 1.5 hours. Then in oven 45 mins lathered with bbq sauce with meat side up and covered with foil. Then another 30 mins covered - flipped over with more bbq sauce. Then turned over meat side up and finished uncovered on high broil for 6 mins. Tender and so good!
easy and good
Very easy and the final result was delicious. Thank you for an easy to follow method. I boiled an hour and baked another, placing ribs under broiler the last 10 minutes. They were perfect.

Sooo, the first time I make a recipe I try to follow exactly. But being the first time I've cooked ribs, I read through a ton of reviews and made several of the changes I saw. The flavor was really good, but they were just a tad drier than I like. I used half beef broth and half water, 3/4 cup liquid aminos (soy sauce), 1tbsp worcestershire, 5 smashed garlic cloves, 1 onion cut in chucks, 3 bay leaves, a few shakes of pepper and some old bay seasoning. I did not add any additional salt. All I has on hand was 2.75lbs of boneless country style ribs. I simmered for 45 mins and let them sit for a few hours in the brine for a few hours (as suggested by a few other reviewers). Then I ladled a few scoops of the liquid into a dutch oven, layed the ribs in and basted with Sweet Baby Rays. Cooked at 225 for 3 hours, basting a few times along the way. Took the top off and broiled for 10 mins t o caramelize. Next time I will simmer for 30 mins and play around with the oven cook time/temp. The family loved them, so it is a keeper! I also took others suggestions and strained the broth, cubed some potatoes and made some killer mashed potatoes!
it is so delicious
The Garlic and Lemon ruined it. Also the meat was tough and chewy. These were inedible to me.
I boiled the meat for about 3/4 of an hour before baking it for about 1.5 hours. It was excellent
Very simple and delicious. I used country style pork ribs, boiled for 45 min. and baked an hour and 15 min. They were perfect. I will definitely make them this way again.
Best ribs ever. I used country style. Only change, I removed the foil for the last half hour so the ribs carmalized a bit.

I didn’t pre boil e ribs. I just towel dry it, marinade in lots of bbq sauce n bake it. I baste it w more bbq sauce n honey mixture. I baked for about 40 mins. Came out tender, juicy n flavourful w bbq sauce. I’m surprised it’s soft w/o e pre boil. I just tried this way n it worked. Easy n yummy!
loved it!
Love this recipe!! Made it many times and it turns out perfect every time!
Recipe was great for fast BBQ Ribs!

Seeing a lot of comments here indicating that people are using racks of ribs and not having much food for four people These are Country Style Ribs. That is a special cut of meat. They are large boneless chunks of meat. This recipe probably works great for racks too.

I've been looking at this recipe seems like forever, and never tried it; I always did my country style ribs in the slow cooker because I thought boiling them would make them tough. Well, today I decided to try it. Oh my gosh! I'll never go back to my old ways again. I had four pounds of country style ribs, some with bone and some not, about 7 ribs. Before I boiled them I put the normal rub I use and let them sit to room temperature. Then I dumped in the same spices I used with the rub - salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic, smoked paprika (yes I eyeball it). Let them simmer 45 minutes. At that point they were pretty tender. Doused them in Sweet Baby Rays on both sides and put in the oven for about 30 minutes. They were awesome! Hubby said needed more salt but he always says that lol. I might leave in oven a few more minutes next time to get even more sticky-ish. Lloyd, sir, you have made a believer out of me!

These ribs were delicious and very tender! I made about four and a half pounds of country boneless pork ribs. I brought the water to a boil then added the ribs along with enough water to cover them. I added three quarters of a cup of soy sauce, one tablespoon of Worcestershire sauce, one tablespoon of minced garlic, one tablespoon of pepper, and onion wedges from one large sweet onion. I let them softly boil for about 50 minutes and then let them sit on the stove covered for an hour and 45 minutes. I then put them in the oven, covered with foil, after coating them with Sweet baby Ray's honey barbecue sauce for 1 hour at 350, basting them halfway through. I took the foil off for the last 15 minutes. Everyone loved them!
I was skeptical about this recipe - boiled meat is not very appetizing. However, these finished up wonderfully and were so easy to prepare. I highly recommend!
No changes. Turned out perfect.
I followed the directions and read several reviews. Boiled for and hour, baked covered an hour and a half, basting rwice. My ribs came out so dry they weren’t edible. What a waste of time and mi eh.
This recipe was so yummy! I had pork rib tips that wre given to me so I wanted to make a yummy dinner. I haven't had much luck cooking bbq ribs but this was super easy and turned out great!
These ribs were so good and not dry like usual. I will definitely make them again. And the recipe is so simple, I loved it. A big thumbs up!!

Made this recipe today with country ribs. It's definitely a keeper. Husband loved it. 
Skimmed fat from water while meat was in the oven. Will use to make soup tomorrow!

I did not cover with aluminum foil before baking, but added it half way through. Turned out great despite my best efforts. Lol. Paired it with mashed potatoes and country gravy, and cheesy green beans.
This is a great method! We threw them on the grill for a few minutes to sear after baking. Juicy, faster cooking!
very easy and very good.
This is a great way to cook delicious ribs!
I boiled then for 45 minutes as someone suggested in a previous comment. I made my BBQ sauce like my mom always makes it, ketchup & dark brown sugar. They came out wonderful!
Really easy recipe!

I hate making ribs because they always come out tuff but my husband loves ribs so I decided to try this recipe. These were very tender and so delicious! I probably added more BBQ sauce (personal preference) and I cooked them in the oven for 1 hour on 350. Will definitely make these again!

I have been making ribs for years. Never had I boiled them. Lloyd's addition to the water of garlic and pepper and salt and such was perfect. I didn't really adjust anything (except I added minced garlic to the water) - I may next time but they came out super duper I don't think I should change a thing
This recipe was fabulous! So tender, but ribs did not fall apart and lose their shape.

I've never made country style ribs and didn't realize the length of time it took so when looking for a shortcut, this is what I found. AMAZING! They came out so tender, I felt like a rockstar when my family dug in.

1st time rib maker!! Quick, simple and straightforward. Yes, you can simmer the ribs longer and modify to suit your taste but.... thanks you’d probably not need a recipe like the newbie rib maker I am! ??

This is my go-to recipe for ribs! I usually just add whatever I want to the water for boiling. Onions, peppers, garlic, smoked paprika, etc. literally whatever you want. Boil for 45 min. Place them in a pan, add a little of the broth from boiling, top with bbq sauce and bake covered at 325 for 1-1/2 hours, and I usually remove the foil and bake 10 min before the timer goes off. Soooooo tender! Literally falling apart!

This is a great recipe I've made several times. I boil for an hour. After coating completely with bbq sauce I place the ribs with fat side up on a broiler pan sprayed with non stick spray. This allows the fat to render and pass through the meat for more flavor. Cover with aluminum foil for the first hour then flip the ribs over coat with more sauce and uncover for the last half hour.
Other than adding onions to the boil and using fresh garlic, I followed the recipe. So delish! Received lots of praise on this one. Thank you for sharing.
The ribs turned out great! They were very moist and fell off the bone. I added some additional spices that weren't in the original recipe that are used for grilling and they worked out well.
I added about 2tsp more of every spice. Plus 2t onion powder. I also added 1T yellow mustard, 2T Worse Chester? sauce?. Boiled for one hour then roasted covered for one hour. Amazing!
Very easy and delicious!

Nice easy recipe. I boiled the ribs about 45 min in water seasoned with Goya Adobo, slathered with Dinosaur BBQ sauce and baked for a hour flipping and slathering more sauce after 30 min. Then I broiled for about 5-8 minutes per side.
I made it tonight. A fantastic 4 ingredients recipe meal! I added a bit of paprika with the basic steps. The meat fell off the bones:) this recipe is a keeper for my family

This is my favorite way of cooking country style ribs! I bring them to a boil with kosher salt, fresh cracked pepper and fresh garlic (we like a lot of garlic), then cover the pan, lower the heat to a simmer, and leave it about an hour. Then I pull the ribs out, place them in an aluminum foil covered cookie sheet or roasting pan (saves on cleanup and conveniently stores leftovers), sprinkle more black pepper, a little onion powder & baste them with plenty of BBQ sauce. Bake as directed, turning after a half hour or so and basting again. They come out sticky and oh-so-yummy EVERY time!

Made as directed....boiling ribs then cooking them in the oven with BBQ sauce has been my favorite way to make ribs for several years now....just incredibly tender & delicious. Already have them in my freezer to cook for Memorial Day. TY for the recipe.
These are the best ribs that I have made. They are super tender. Very easy recipe.

Use common sense to cook, add love.. And it works 
Plus 50 mins in the oven covered, then 10 mins uncovered.
My only issue was I use the wrong BBQ sauce. Once they were done I added Sweet Baby Rays and fixed the flavor. Great recipe ???? Thank you for sharing.
We LOVED this recipe. I baked it for the 1 1/2 hours and it was just falling off the bone. I combined a couple different BBQ sauces and they were perfect. Making it again as I type.

I use Western ribs for this recipe. I boiled them with the spices for 1/2 hour & then baked them for 1 1/2 hours. I used honey BBQ sauce. They were so tender it was hard to lift them out of the dish! Most delicious ribs we've ever eaten & SO easy. Very flavorful! We actually are hooked on them & have had them 3 times in the last 1 1/2 months!
2 tablespoons of salt was TOO salty! Not using this recipe again.
great results and easy to make.

3 stars if using this recipes cook times. I swapped the cooked times and now it'sa 5 star recipe ;) . I boiled for an hour then baked on a high temp for only 15 mins to thicken the bbq sauce quickly! It made a huge difference in the tenderness! Very juicy!
It turned out great...every single time I make it!! I've made this same recipe 5 times now!!!
Very good, my family loved it. Will be making this again.

Best, easiest, moistest ever. Perfect as it is. After preparing it several times, this is what I do: 1- cut into pieces of 2-3 ribs each. 2- dry rub with bbq seasoning of choice. 3- boil for 45 minutes. (If I’m not ready to bake yet, I let them sit in the water until I’m ready. I feel like the times I’ve had to let them sit for an hour or more made them come out super good). 4- transfer to baking sheet in foil pocket(s) covered in favorite BBQ sauce. 5- bake fo 45 minutes. Done. And perfect!!!!
Never posted before, but these are fantastic and easy. Best ribs I have ever made! I also added onion, celery, garlic and Worcestershire sauce to the water while boiling. I will make again for sure!

Delicious!! Per some reviews I added soy and a quartered onion to the water, boiled for 1 hour, and let sit in the broth for another hour. Added sauce and baked for 1 hour, removed foil cover, added more sauce and left under the broiler for 10 minutes. Brushed again with light sauce. Keeper recipe.
Awesome recipe and very easy to make!
It was good and super easy to make. If I ever have ribs I will this again

This was first time making ribs that wasn’t in a slow cooker. I followed the instructions and some reader suggestions by adding sauce right before I removed from oven and I was blown away. The ribs were so flavorful and delicious! This was so easy to do and they turned out fantastic! Will make this from now on!

I made these and they are amazon. Only thing I have to say was my next time making it I'm using a tablespoon of salt. I don't know if it was the amount of pork ribs I had but it was a little too salty for me. I also used boneless ribs. but i will be making this agian. the ribs are so tender.
No changes, perfectly simple
Boiled on low for 45 minutes. Follow the recipe, eat and be merry!
Absolutely love this recipe!! Easy to make and tastes great

These ribs turned out AMAZING! Family loved! I wasn't sure how long to boil. This dosnt say. So I had two meaty full slabs. About 7 lbs total. I cut them into 4 half racks. I placed them in the boiling water with garlic powder, pepper.and salt for about 45-50 min. Then I used a big deep foil roasting pan and put the 4 half slabs in there and coated with lots of BBQ sauce. Tightly covered with foil and cooked on 350 degrees for about 1.5-2 hours. I had much more meat than this recipe so increased temperature and time a little. Then took off foil and put more sauce on and broiled it for about 5-6 min to get a little crisp on top. They were just so so tender. Fell off the bone and so easy....
Absolutely delicious. Made them a couple of weeks ago. Family couldn't stop raving about them. Getting ready to make them again for dinner tonight per my husband's request.

These are the only ribs I make now. I’ve made them for a few years and they’re always a hit. I season them with just about anything and everything. (Garlic powder, onion powder, bbq rub, season-all, dehydrated peppers, dehydrated onions, etc) What ever you want. Cover them with water and I boil them for about 45 minutes, remove from water, place in pan, add bbq sauce (I drown them in it , plus add a little of the boiled water as well), and I bake them for 1-1/2 hours and they come out perfectly tender and falling apart.

These were pretty good, a bit tough though. I broiled them for a few minutes at the end to get the sauce sticky. I would make them again, but I'm not sure how long to boil them. Maybe I'd be better off just slow roasting in the oven.

It turned out great.I didn’t cook as long in oven but it still was fork tender .Will definitely be my way from now on to cook country style ribs.I did use Goya adobe,garlic powder,salt and pepper,chili powder and Worcestershire sauce .my new go to.?

The first time I made these, they were a little bland and tougher than they should be. last time I boiled them at about an hour and and baked them for about 2.5 hours. I also pulled them out somewhere in the middle and applied more bbq sauce. Also, at the end I broiled them uncovered on the top rack for a few minutes to thicken up the on top.
Also added onion wedges, served with baked spaghetti squash. 5+ stars!
The meat was falling off the bone!
Yes I will definitely make this again. It was super easy and delicious
we liked it. thanks. I use the liquid that gets poured off to make a nice pot of beans. It's full of flavor
I tweaked it a bit like what others suggested, I added worcestershire sauce and soy sauce. I boiled it for an hour and in the oven for another. I went all out with the bbq sauce. Turned out so good!

OMG best ribs ever. I used baby back cause I couldn’t find those, sweet baby rays bbq sauce, and I added adobo seasoning and a sweet rib rub from Walmart. Boiled with the adobo for 45 minutes then added the bbq and seasonings and cooking in the oven for an hour and a half. Falling off the bone. Soooo good.
Remove the clear membrane from the ribs prior to cooking.

This was very simple and time saving way to make ribs. I left the ribs in the oven for the 1 1/2 hour time frame. They were not fall off the bone ready at that point. If I had had the time, I would have left them in the oven for a while longer.

I appreciate other people’s responses as it helps me. This was fabulous! I added a purple onion and soy sauce to the pot to boil the ribs in like someone else suggested. I boiled the ribs for an hour.
I also doubled the bbq sauce and basted them after 45 minutes. I baked them s total of 75 minutes. They almost fell off the bones they were so tender.
I also used the boiling liquid to cook potatoes, carrots and celery in but pulled out the potatoes and mashed them with butter and heavy whipping cream. 
The meal was sensational by the words of my wife. I agree.
These are awesome as described; I'm on my fifth rack today.
Easy and delicious, I followed the recipe as directed.

I doubled the recipe to serve 6 but made made no additional changes. Boiled the ribs for about 1 1/2 hours, refrigerated them until the next day and baked them with the sauce according to the recipe. Our guests loved them!
AMAZING! I took your recipe but added a little liquid smoke and Worcestershire sauce to the water when I boiled it. Thanks for sharing! Everyone loves these
These are amazing! Instead of boiling the ribs, I put them in the Instant pot for about 15 minutes.
Excellent!! Tender and tasty!
Deeeeeeelicious! Will make again for sure!
loved

I made this tonight and maybe I done something wrong because it was really dry and not moist at all. I boiled until tender, then cooked at 325° for 1 hour as advised. the flavour was good, just super dry.
Easy and super tasty. Nothing else needs be said.

This is the best way to make BBQ ribs at home if you don’t have a grill. I added extra seasonings after boiling it , before putting it in the oven (cumin, paprika, adobo, more garlic powder, chili powder, and brown sugar). I also added bbq sauce. The finale was adding more bbq sauce and broiling it for 10 min. Got a nice crispy coat, while the inside remained juicy.

Nice tender ribs made it for the whole family and they all loved it. Very easy to make and I will sure make it again! The only downside is that it takes two and a bit hours to make and it usually only takes around an hour and a half.
